articles.author: Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: Marine Le Pen's far-right National Rally (RN) party scored historic gains to win the first round of France's parliamentary election, but the final outcome will depend on days of alliance-building before next week's run-off vote.
articles.title: Historic win for far right in French first-round vote

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: The Palestinian Islamic Jihad group fired a barrage of rockets into Israel on Monday, in an apparent show of force as Israeli tanks pressed their advance deeper into Gaza amid fierce fighting, residents and officials said.
articles.title: Gaza militants fire rockets into Israel, as tanks advance in north and south

articles.author: Kate Holton
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will on Monday say only his Conservatives can counter a Labour-led government and that a vote for Nigel Farage's right-wing Reform UK would hamper any chance of his party forming a strong opposition.
articles.title: UK's Sunak says only his Conservatives can form strong opposition to Labour

articles.author: Tom Bateman
articles.description: Park rangers on Japan's sacred Mount Fuji officially started this year's climbing season about 90 minutes before sunrise on Monday, levying new trail fees and limiting hiker numbers to curb overcrowding.
articles.title: Japan imposes new fees on Mount Fuji climbers to limit tourists

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Monday that a Belarusian military report that Ukraine had been moving more troops, weapons and military equipment into its northern Zhytomyr region, which borders Belarus, was a cause for concern.
articles.title: Kremlin says report that Ukraine is reinforcing Belarus border is a worry

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Bulgaria's President Rumen Radev handed Rosen Zhelyazkov of the centre-right GERB party a mandate to try to form a government on Monday, after it won the most seats in a parliamentary election last month.
articles.title: Bulgaria's centre-right GERB party to try to form minority government

articles.author: Rishika Sadam, Aditi Shah
articles.description: New Delhi's main domestic terminal is likely to remain shut for a few weeks with debris still scattered outside the airport following last week's roof collapse, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters on Monday.
articles.title: New Delhi's domestic airport terminal likely to be shut for a few weeks, sources say

articles.author: Catarina Demony, Charlotte Van Campenhout
articles.description: As the Netherlands marks on Monday 161 years since the abolition of slavery, activists have questioned the sincerity of recent apologies by Dutch authorities given they have not addressed the politically thorny issue of reparations.
articles.title: Advocates for reparations say Dutch slavery apologies not enough

articles.author: Ju-Min Park
articles.description: An online petition calling for South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol to be impeached experienced delays and disruptions due to the large number of people trying to sign it, the speaker of the parliament said, promising to fix the issue as soon as possible.
articles.title: Delays, disruptions as South Koreans surge to sign online petition to impeach president

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two Russian regions declared a state of emergency on Monday as summer wildfires spread amid intense heat.
articles.title: Russia declares state of emergency in two regions due to forest fires
